qas.question: What British nobleman attempted to retain European alliances following the Seven Years' War?
What countries joined Britain as allies?
Did the European countries see Britain or France as a greater threat?

answers.text: now saw Britain as a greater threat than France

qas.question: When did the American War of Independence turn into a global conflict?
What drove Prussia away from renewing its alliance with Britain?

answers.text: Prussians were angered by what they considered a British betrayal in 1762

context: The war had also brought to an end the "Old System" of alliances in Europe, In the years after the war, under the direction of <a0_0>Lord Sandwich<a0_0/>, the British did try to re-establish this system. But after her surprising grand success against a coalition of great powers, European states such as Austria, The Dutch Republic, Sweden, Denmark-Norway, Ottoman Empire, and Russia <a2_0>now saw Britain as a greater threat than France<a2_0/> and did not join them, while the <a4_0>Prussians were angered by what they considered a British betrayal in 1762<a4_0/>. Consequently, when the American War of Independence turned into a global war between <a3_0>1778–83<a3_0/>, Britain found itself opposed by a strong coalition of European powers, and <a1_0>lacking any substantial ally<a1_0/>.
